Welcome to Darwin!
lcm:~ root# gzip -t 
/RAID01/1/1_job_1120859484/LC-20050712000448-00068-lcs0001.local.arc.gz
lcm:~ root#

lcm:/Users/admin/heritrix-1.4.0/bin root# ./arcreader -s 
/RAID01/1/1_job_1120859484/LC-20050712000448-00068-lcs0001.local.arc.gz 
 > arcreader.tmp
lcm:/Users/admin/heritrix-1.4.0/bin root# ls -al arcreader.tmp
-rw-r--r--   1 root  staff  4356497 Jul 14 11:33 arcreader.tmp

tail'ing arcreader.tmp doesn't show anything unexpected.

I'm dying on this command:
/Users/Admin/heritrix-1.5.0/bin/extractor $file > $procfn

lcm:/RAID01/1/1_job_1120859484 root# ls -al 
LC-20050712000448-00068-lcs0001.*       
-rw-r--r--   1 nobody  nobody  100014425 Jul 12 05:53 
LC-20050712000448-00068-lcs0001.local.arc.gz
-rw-r--r--   1 root    nobody    1010352 Jul 14 10:21 
LC-20050712000448-00068-lcs0001.local.urls

The ARC was successfully closed.  As a matter of fact, this crawl is 
still in progress and I wrote a quick
and dirty perl script to process the closed .arc.gz's only.  I actually 
have other ARCs causing this as well
(all closed, 100 MB) -- this was just the one I found aborting 
"quickest".  Basically every 100 MB ARC
produces about 100 MB of uncompressed URLs.  The problem doesn't seem s 
to be in extracting
individual links from a given document in the ARC? 


stack wrote:

>
> We're failing on a basic read of the gzipped ARC.   Does it fail each
> time?  What is the output if you do ${HERITRIX_HOME}/bin/arcreader -s
> ARCNAME?  Does it read any records from the ARC (or just not the last)? 
> What does gzip -t say about the ARC?  (There are cases where the last
> gzip member in an ARC can be incomplete if Heritrix is shutdown
> improperly (Crash, etc.) but usually in this case the ARCs will still
> have the '.open' extension).
> Thanks,
> St.Ack
>
>
